text: Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Pours clear brown. Aroma is light caramel, soft piney hops, little nuts. Body is medium, lively carbonated and rather sweet, even a bit sticky. Little bitterness. Some nut flavours, syrup. Rather sweet palate. Still not my type of beer, but this is okay.

Head is creamy dense, beige average long lasting. Beer is clear copper brown, dark orange. Aroma is medium intense after caramel, floral hops, a bit metallic and here it comes..gingerbread.
Taste is averagely malty sweet, burnt caramel, and medium bitter. Finish is medium bitter and almost long lasting. Carbonation is refreshing but not overwhelming. A beer that is not complicated, enjoyable without any flaws, almost. By now the best Maibock i drank.

500 ml bottle, servec in mug. Nice amber copper colour, medium head. Malt, caramel, dark bread. Malty sweetness and nice hoppy bitterness, very smooth and süffig, also a bit metallic. Oily texture, medium body. Soft carbonated. Nice Maibock!

Draft. Pours clear bright copper with a creamy off white head. Tastes like bready and caramel malts, faint hops, smooth yeast, and a hint of dried fruits. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like bready and caramel malts, faint hops, smooth yeast, and a hint of dried fruits.
Tap. Pours clear copper. Aroma and flavor are bready and caramel malts, light noble hop character, smooth lager yeast esters. Light/medium body.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 for the damn book. The pour is a darker clear golden orange with a thinner light cream colored head and a couple spots of lace as it settles to a thick ring. The aroma is sweet and lightly metallic. There is a lot of corn in this as well. The flavor is really sweet and malty. I like the sweet potato maltiness. There isnt a lot else happening around, which is not that great. The mouth feel is definitely light and watery with a lack of carbonation and a hint of syrupiness on the finish. The aftertaste is bland malt and a touch f sweetness. Nah.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. For the book. Aroma is fruity, caramel, earthy hops, wheat, slightly metallic, nice. Appearance is amber golden, clear, light tan head. Taste is floral, fruity, bitter, malty, metallic, its ok. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, bitter hops, fruity metallic aftertaste. Overall, its pretty good.

Draught at Hofbräuhaus München. 
Copper, clear body, with a big, fluffy, rocky, lacing, light beige head. 
Aroma of caramel, flowers, grains, bread, some cocoa, some toast, some sweet fruits. 
Tastes pretty similar, with a bit alcohol. 
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation. 
Finishes medium sweet, medium toasty, a bit dry, a bit floral, hoppy, a bit warming, with cocoa, caramel, bread. 

Really nice. Very quaffable and not too sweet, although with quite a lot of caramel, still with enough toasty and grainy notes. Very good, characterful Bock, although it is more a dark than a pale one.

0.5l bottle. Clear dark orange body with a lasting white head. Aroma of bread, sugar syrup, raisins, orange zest and floral hops. Taste of bread, caramel, raisins and orange zest with grassy and floral hops. Great maibock. The label says it is available all around the World. Hungary is and exception, but hopefully itll show up here at spring time too.

Nice Amber color pours into New Glarus dimpled mug. I have a lifelong affection for German beers of all varieties and there heritage. Havent had the opportunity to try this one as its the first time Ive seen it available outside a Hofbrau variety pack. This one hits the mark. Very bready and malty. Has a hop presence but it doesnt distract from the sweet maltiness. Pretty simple on the palate but quite delicious.

Date code L 016 Q 07:43, which apparently means bottled in mid January, 2017. Reviewed April 8, 2017. Bready aroma with spice. Deep golden color with tiny carbonation bubbles. An impressive looker. Topped (after a vigorous pour) with a tall, bubbly, off-white just nudging toward tan head, leaving thick lacing, but in no hurry to recede. Substantial to moderate feel with tingling on the tongue. Bready, toasty, and slightly spicy. Moderate bitterness asserts in the middle and finish, fading quickly. Leaves a pleasant sweetish malt or even caramel taste on the tongue and in the mouth. Malty, pushing toward but not to the point of being sweet. Balanced by the spiciness and moderate to light bitterness ("moderate to light" in the context of American craft beer, not in the context of traditional German lagers). This is excellent.
Draft. Active head, good carbonation. Mineral, leather and herbal aromas. Light palate and plain bitterness.

Clear copper body, white fizzy head. At first I thought it smelled a bit skunky, but it actually has some sweet malty characteristics. Taste is pretty much like a slightly sweeter more powerful helles. Okay.
A half litre draught. Lovely copper colour with a dirty white head. No strong aroma and a medium strong taste with a hit of alcohol in the after taste. You cant go wrong with a hofbrauhaus beer!
Pours clear copper golden with a short white head. Nose comprised of metallic, toasted malt, and skunk. Flavors are identical.

Aroma: herbs and malty notes.
Appearance: clear golden color and white head.
Taste: malty, low herbal bitterness, celler, warming alcohol, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carboantion, malty finish.
Overall: Rather decent Maibock.

red amber pour big light tan head. Aroma honey, brandied grapes, rye bread. Tastes big bready sweet. some herbal hops. theres a bit of a clash between the hops and malts, not really working balanced, but theres tons of great flavor.
Draught at the Hofbräu Munich. Tired maltiness in the aroma. Alcoholic taste and light sweetness. Thin body for a bock. Very nice appearance.

Tasty maibock, heavy caramel malt backed by a mild nutty undertone, slight apple esters rising from the yeast, leading to a moderately sweet, boozy finish. Modest hops add a pungent, slightly medicinal bitterness to the back end, yet the fade is smooth and sweet. Pretty orange pour gives up a fluffy white head, but the somewhat lackadaisical nose never matches the lovely malt core. Doesnt matter. Tastes good.
0.5l bottle from tengelmann in münchen. pours a clear amber with a steady white head. aroma of cranberries(!), apples, a hint of caramel. flavour of bread, wood. nice one, especially aroma.
Klar bärnstensfärgad l med ett gulvitt skum. Doft och smak av karamell, lätt blommighet och maltighet. Lätt alkoholsötma och en gräsig efterbeska.

#969Vielen Dank nach Bochum!Clear amber body, small white head. Pleasant aroma of cranberries, rhubarb, candies, cherries...hut unfortunately hints of metal. Taste is neutral to sweet with slightly bitter finish. Wood, caramel, cherries, liqueur. Full body, high carbonation. It has character of commercial brew, too neutral. Whats pitty.

Many thanks for this Top Beer To Kevnic2008. Piana sprora tresciwa kremowa i utrzymujaca sie prawie do konca degustacji. Kolor bursztynowy z jasniutkimi refleksami truskawkowej czerwieni. Zapach ciasta drozdzowego, w smaku slodowe ale subtelnie chmielnosc niewielka, alkohol lekko rozgrzewajacy. Porzadny jasny i Kozlaczek i sezonowy w dodatku. Polecam nie tylko w maju.

Bottle from trade with pivnizub, thanks Guenther! Bottle 0.5l. Clear, pale amber colored. AROMA- grainy, caramel, touch of bread, note of metal. FLAVOR- neutral, slightly bitter, again grains, bread and caramel, light, a bit harsh alcohol presence. Medium bodied, very attenuated. Not bad, but not my style.

Bottle from Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is caramel, toffee, raisins, sweet herbal things, caramel apples. Taste is malty, caramel apples, raisins and gently moves to a grassy, herbal and slightly bitter finish. Amazing fruit, malt and herbal components blending together on this one...also bready and earthy, but not too dank, and very drinkable.

On tap at Tipplers Tap 011016. There are plenty of German beers on tap around Brisbane at the moment with this one being left over from Tipplers Taps Oktoberfest event the weekend before. Smooth and slightly malty with a nice long finish.

Aroma; fruits, plum, peel, marmalade, caramel, apple, leaves.
Look; off white bighead, amber clear body. Taste; solid hops in the caramel malt liquid, apple note, herbs, abstract spices, sweets, honey - leading to a soft sweet finish, still with hops. Feel; good. Overall; good may-bock. [50cl.btl abv7.2% BB.16.11.16]

On tap. Pours a clear copper with a medium, long lasting, off-white head that laces. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, fruit and brown sugar. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, bread and fruit with a hint of alcohol in a slightly dry finish. Medium body with a watery texture and soft carbonation.

Tap (Hofbrau, Berlin) (7:4:6+:4:13+=3.4++)
Nice orangey copper, tight off-white head. Nice rich malty aroma, some soyish savoury aspects, even marmitey in places. Rich malty body. Sweetish, but not sticky. Full. Clean, but characterful. Lovely bock. Gentle noble hop herbal finish. Very drinkable.
Flaske 0.5L hos Djoeye. Farge klar rav med offwhite. Lukt plomme fruktig humle. Smak karamell, frukt, malt, søtlig. Fint avrundet alkoholsmak, fyldig og god
Clear amber, small head. Smells apple jam. Sweet jam in the taste with some rough finish.
Bottle - dark copper color with a creamy head. Malty, nutty, dried fruits, quite sweet and boozy. Okay, but not my favorite. Smoothness is lacking.

Tasted from draft. Pours a clear amber. Aroma is caramel, toffee, herbal. Taste is moderate to heavily sweet malt with a faint bitterness. Flavors of caramel, toffee, maple, nutty, earthy. Very good maibock. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had a half liter at Estabrook Park Beergarden. Very hopped up brew with a malty flavor.
Klasyka, sporo słodu, sporo świeżego karmelu. Fajne ciało, gruba faktura. Aromat i smak przyjemne, ale bez szału. Jak na styl - ok, styl - trochę nuda.

Tap (Hofbräu Berlin, Berlin). Clear caramel color. Huge size, thick off-white head, stays. Metallic, sweet, malty in aroma. Sweet, metallic, hops, malty and caramel in taste. Sweet caramelly malts in aftertaste. Quite drinkable one.
On tap @ Hofbräuhaus, Starkbierzeit 2016. Édeskés, testes, mégis könnyen csúszott. Elég sűrű, de nem volt alkoholos. Kicsit olyan volt mint a winterzwickl.
From the bottle poured into Tuilp glass. Nice amber color and off white head. Nose of malt and grass. Taste is rich malty grassy herbal with faint alcoholic finish. Nice...

Clear bronze with little white head. Aroma: Dark fruits, caramel and much roast. Also alcohol. Taste is bitter, more alcohol. Very little sweetness. Texture is fizzy, feels like foam in the mouth. Overall too much alcohol, too much bitterness. Not my favourite.
kupfer- bis bronzefarben mit schöner weißer Schaumkrone. Der Bock ist ausgeprägt süßlich malzig, karamellig, leicht röstig und bitter. Gut!

Malty, spicy, with some ethers.
Taste moderate sweet with some acidity.
Spicy hoppy finish 

Not bad.
11.2 oz. bottle. Poured copper with an off white head. Aroma was caramel, raisins and fruit. Taste was bittersweet, biscuit and lingering mild bitter finish.
Mid to light body not as sweet as others but kinda boozy. Bitter and sugary. Really not the best but strong enough to give you that kick in the pants. Really not the best maibock.

330 ml bottle in FL.

Excellent appearance: clear, deep Amber body with plenty of visible carbonation rising to a large, durable off-white head.
Mediocre aroma with better flavor. Smooth and well balanced. About equal levels of hops and malts mid-taste. Finished with a surprisingly hoppy aftertaste.

0,5 l Flasche. Riecht nach Röstmalz und Möhren. Das Bier ist braun, der Schaum flach und cremeweiß. Es schmeckt nach Röstmalz, intensiv karamellig. Erst im Nachgeschmack erkennt man den erhöhten Alkoholgehalt. Sehr lecker.

On tap @ Expo 2015, Milano. Il gusto al naso riconosce arancia, pane, orzo e luppolo. Lintensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è considerevole. Il cappello di schiuma compatta è formato da bollicine fini a carbonazione media. Il liquido ha frizzantezza dovuta a bollicine fini con carbonazione bassa e media. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. Il colore è ambrato carico tendente rossiccio. Il corpo è strutturato. Lamaro è deciso. Sono presenti anche piccole componenti di salato e umami. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è lunga. Il gusto è godereccio. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono luppolate e dalla pericolosa beverinità per una "ottima birra". Il finale è felpato, lungo e complesso. Il retrogusto è persistente. Laroma in bocca segnala percezioni di arrostito, abete rosso e agrumi.
I know its traditional but I still found it average. No real aroma. Nice color and head. Light and crisp palate. Bready malt with a grainy sense. Very low hop profile but well-balanced.

Aroma: Very aromatic. Clover honey, graham cracker, sweet roasty malt.
Palate: Smooth and full-bodied.
Flavor: Roasty malt, clover honey with graham cracker and cinnamon midway through. 
Comment: Brilliantly smooth with full mouth feel while not being cloying nor overly heavy.

It is a good helles bock, in my opinion better than the augustiner. The colour is copper,ruby and the carbonation and the foam are average. The taste is malty and you could feel some caramel and few ginger bread. It is a good beer to finish a night.

From the 330 ml green bottle. Attractive mahogany brown pour under a big off-white head. Sweet and roasted malts erupts on the nose. Medium and creamy body. An approachable sweetness and malt character at first in the taste with a clean, mild bitterness at the end.
Orange-amber pour with thin beige head. Light aroma aromas of cooked sugar and mild earth hop. Flavor is malty with a slight tang. Pretty tasty stuff, and well balanced for the abv.

Orangee tirant sur le ruby, pas de carbo, petit collet de grosses bulles,fuyant.
Aromes caramel, pain
Tres mince mais belle présence des céréales malté et caramel sur la finale.
7% mais on a limpression quil y en a plus.

On tap at Chinesischer Turm in Munich. Great amber color with nice tan head. Aroma is caramel, a bit metallic. Taste is caramel malts, bread, sweet feeling, spicy, oily mouthfeel, and a noticeable amount of booze in the back, not too much though. Low carbonation. Not a bad bock, not even too sweet or too boozy, but not too memorable either.

330ml bottle into schooner glass. Sweet caramel malt nose. Golden bronze beer with solid white head. Slight zing, thick oily body. Super malty taste, real caramel. Palate is short, more malt and a tiny bitterness. Absolutely delicious. Hides its alcohol well.
Copper color ; huge, yellowish head. Aroma of caramel malt , bread , dried fruits , hint of herbs. Malty , caramel , bread taste with balancing , hoppy bitterness at the end .

Poured from 11.2 oz into pilsner glass.

Appearance: pours a healthy 2+" off white head which drops quickly with a bit of lacing. Color is clear copper with moderate streaming carbonation.
Aroma: rich malty sweetness, caramel, and some floral hops
Mouthfeel: medium bodied, resiny and a bit chewy with a moderately dry finish.
Flavor: toasted whole wheat bread, caramel, raisins, a bit of citrus rind, alcohol is detectable but mild considering the ABV
Overall: extremely good, cant find anything to criticize in this brew.

Draught @ Beer Deluxe, Melbourne
Rich honey/amber body, white head persists.
Malty nose; toast, bread crust, pale caramel, faint grainy/DMS note.
Full, sticky, restrained carbonation.
Palate delivers plenty of clean malt notes - caramel, pale toffee, biscuit, toast, some nuttiness. Long finish, subdued bitterness, somewhat sweet.
Lovely malty beer. - would love to see more of this style.
Rated based on notes taken 14 July 2012 -- Pretty good German beer from the bottle. I can only imagine that it is amazing fresh on draft.
Really good. You will not be disappointed... unless you dont enjoy good beer. If so, why do you use ratebeer?

Rating #1129 - June 12, 2014 - Bottle from CBI - Pours a golden copper colour with a frothy white head that bubbles away slowly. Aroma is rich, light citrus, hint of grassiness, mild alcohol. Taste is medium to full bodied, and the alcohol is masked slightly with the earthy, floral hops and grassiness,but certainly brings a heavy warmth and a bit of a earthy, boozy bite. Lovely.

Tap at Arts and Crafts Beer Parlor. Pours honey orange. White frothy head. Which rests upon the beer. Aroma is cherry, toffee, sweet malts, stone fruits. Flavor is super malty, sweet caramel, honey, lager crispness, stone fruits, toffee. Solid maibock.

Clear amber liquid without head. Aroma: apple, caramel. Taste: roasted malts, caramel, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long bitter finish,
Bottle. Pours clear amber, almost no head. Aroma is sweetish, malty, caramel, plums, peas. Taste is bitter, grassy, malty, some sweetness, caramel, reisin. Medium body. Good beer.

1/3 liter at Hofbrauhaus Columbus on 5/31/15. Pours a clear copper color with a thick tan head. Aroma of malt, sweet caramel, bread and light fruit. Sweet malt and caramel flavor with a sweet bread and malt finish.
On tap at Hofbrauhaus in Las Vegas. Pours a copper color with white head. Malty, toast, earthy, bread aromas and flavors. Not bad.

The beer pours a clear auburn color with a medium off-white head that fades quickly. The aroma blends bready and slightly toasted malts with some spicy and floral hops, and the taste is mildly sweet with the golden, almost buttery, malts being the predominant flavor. Towards the finish, a quick bite of hops hits the tongue, but it never overpowers. The palate fuses a thick and slick texture, medium body, and a soft carbonation.

L:
-pours a clear copper with a big,quickly dissipating,frothy white head
-high carbonation visible
S:
-grainy,caramel,toffee,spicy,bready
 the nose with a clinging sweetness and a bready finish
F:
medium body,medium carbonation
O:
Stronger and maltier than a typical Maibock.
Good Brew nonetheless

330 ml bottle into lager glass, bottled on 1/21/2015. Pours crystal clear deep orange/amber color with a 1 finger dense off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of toast, biscuit, honey, light caramel, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance of bready malt and earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of big toast, biscuit, honey, light caramel, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Light earthy herbal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of toast, biscuit, honey, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice robustness and balance of bready malt and earthy hop flavors; with a great bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Very clean on lager flavors with zero yeast ester notes present. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and fairly creamy/bready mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a damn nice maibock. All around great robustness and balance of bready malt and earthy hop flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

Bottle.

A- Malty, corn, cereal.

A- Copper color, clear liquid, light tan head.

T- Malty, cereal, grass, corn, subtle alcohol, subtle caramel.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, malty finish.

O- Not very flavorful and honestly had my eyes been closed I wouldnt notice that much difference from a standard amber lager. It was okay but thats it.

Bottle in season sitting on the deck at Shades of Green. Smells like spring with a slightly sweet and grassy nose with a hint of hops. Light amber color with a head that lasts forever. Pretty classic maibock flavor with a little lingering booze. Nice and true to style.

Sehr schön -- gießt orange-rot mit dicker weißer Schaumkrone ein. Aromen von süßen Malzen, etwas Zitrone, trockenem Obst. Geschmack ist spritzig-süß mit einem pflaumig-süßem Abgang. Wenig alkoholig, sehr schön ausgewogen.
Overall: Nuts, bread, sweet, dried fruits.Note: On-tap at De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2015-05-02.

0,5 l bottle from local dursty, best before 3/11/2015. Crystal clear, medium amber with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan to white head. Pleasant aroma of cane sugar, raisins, prunes and honey. Sweetish taste of cane sugar, raisins, molasses and hints of honey, followed by a medium long, balancing, slightly bitter finish. Medium to full body, oily mouthfeel, soft to average carbonation. Not very complex, but simply tasty, round and very quaffable. Nice!
Tap. Color is orange with white head. Bread and butter honey aroma. Taste is crisp sweet biscuit

0,5 l botttle. Pours out in the glass clear red golden, maybe copper, with a huge head. Smell is sweet sticky malty. Taste starts decent malty, light fruity, later grainy and increasing toasted malt, all in a smooth way. No real bitterness. Nice one.

Pours a medium frothy white head atop a copper brown body. Nose of bread and honey water. Mild notes of white wine beneath toasted malt. Good representation of the style. Bottle courtesy of Jonas. Thanks.

11.2
Looks amber. It smells of caramel and bockiness. Wheat bread. Tastes smooth quite drinkable and like the smell. Very nice beer.
La Urbock è ottima, in linea con la Eggenberg Urbock come sapore, colore ambra scuro tendente al rosso, molto forte il gusto di malto e un pelo speziata, finale leggermente secco.

Nice amber/orange color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of malt, woody hops, some caramel, & spice; Flavor of slight sweet malt, hops, caramel, and fruit; Finish is dry and slightly bitter; Good overall - I enjoyed this one.
The standard. Raisin aromas backed with malty, malty toasty and dried fruit beautness ( its a Fucking word orright?) sensational beer to session or savour

I had this at Global Brew. Pours Amber with a off white head. Taste caramel, malt, sweet. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks kerenmk. Pours yellow to brown with a nice beige head, aroma of herbs, caramel, flavor of caramel, honey and herbs, medium bodied.

On tap. Aroma piuttosto intenso di caramello, malto, miele dacacia, leggermente erbaceo, erbe officinali. Colore ramato, schiuma beige fine e poco persistente. Gusto amabile, maltato, caramello e miele sono i primi palesarsi, sul finale leggermente amara da luppolo, pochissima tostatura. Abbastanza equilibrata molto rotonda, piena, calda alcolica. Equilibrata ed armonica.

A bit of skunkiness in the nose (the beer was from a (green) bottle). Copper color. Sweet nose. Smooth caramel up front. Not very complex. A slight touch of alcohol in the finish. Comes off more as a session beer in terms of flavor and drinkability although its 7.2% ABV makes it anything but. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
caramel, bready malts, something burnt at first, light banana? sweet very sweet, a little bit thickish... some banana and some malt in finish... nice

"Not bad, not bad. A bit bready and sweet. The aroma has a hint of yeasty spiciness that the flavor does not. A good example of the style, but not quite a standout. Crisp and clean...cleaner on tap it seems. Good fall beer."
Had a stein of this in the sunshine in the Englischer Garten in Munich. Aroma of malt sweetness and a little spicy hop. Pours a nice deep copper color with a quickly diminishing head.

Bottle from Seijo Ishi store at Kuzuha Mall. Grainy, very sweet maltiness, light earthy and floral notes. Light copper color. Moderately sweet initial, gentle raisin, mild hopping in mid and final, and not much else. Thin-medium body. Light and pleasant, with a small alc. kick.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Excellent Little Brother for the bottle! Clear and reddish with cream colour foam. Very malty, seedy aroma, bitter, slightly sweet and warm malty taste, then more bitterness. Medium-bodied, long, bitter, grainy finish.

Vom fass at Bier Museum in Koln. Clear orange-brown with a good bubbly head. Malty, smooth, sweet and tasty. A hint of alcohol menace and light caramel. Malty aroma - thats about it, maybe a bit of chocolate malt. One HBs best.

Pours a very clear amber lager with reddish highlights. Bread-forward aroma with some caramel. Flavor is sweet bread and toffee with moderate bitterness, finishes cleanly enough for a very nice balance. Lighter carbonation which I appreciate. I liked this, a bit boozy and dangerous this beer is balanced enough that you feel like having a second one, then the alcohol can sneak up on you. Still though, I enjoyed this.

500ml bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (£3.60):
Quite lager like initially, albeit a slightly stronger smelling with some solid malts and hints of sweetness. There is some background fruit & a pleasant freshness to the beer with some subtle grassy hops and very faint hints of alcohol too.

Clear, red tinged amber with a large, foamy white head & dome shaped head about 5cm tall with little movement and some lacing.

Malty taste combined with some sweetness & spice. Clean & fresh with some bitterness towards the end but in truth this is minimal. Grassy hops feature from about the middle on & are fairly subtle with the balanced malt taste dominating.

Clean, well balanced & full bodied beer with quite light carbonation & bitter aftertaste. The beer is smooth & goes down very easily.

Quite an enjoyable one from Hofbräuhaus despite the fact that there wasnt exactly a whole lot going on with this one other than the balance malts throughout. The beers most appealing aspects were the full bodied and smooth taste as well as how easy it was to sip away at.
Had this in the bottle in USA. Pretty unimpressed with this brew, but i can imagine that its much better overseas.

Süffig-süßlich im Beginn, frisch und leicht. Die helle und typische Bockbier-Süße kommt zum Hauptteil durch, bleibt aber frisch und nicht zu tief. Mild und leicht. Im Nachgeschmack etwas süßlicher werdend, nicht sonderlich herb, sehr süffig.

At a tasting, thanks kerenmk, smallish creamy head, clear very light brown, colour with orange hues, malty aroma with brad and paper notes, candy malty flavour with some herbal bitterness, alcohol showing through, a little heavy. Drinkable but not really interesting.

bottle. crystal clear amber with a small white head. malty, buttery aroma. full bodied. flavors of toffee, pale malt, butter, earthy, floral hops, candy. a moderate sweetness in this beer. i enjoyed it, albiet, not fresh.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks kerenmk. Clear deep golden with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, some graininess, bread, a herbal hint and an alcoholic touch. Sweetish flavor, malt, a bit alcoholic, with grains and a slightly bitterish finish with a herbal hint. Medium-bodied.

12 oz bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a clear dark copper, with a large fluffy beige head which fades into a disc on the surface and leaves good lacing. Nose is sweet malt. Taste is caramel and malt, with a moderate mouth feel and a short, sweet finish. Pretty good exemplar of the style.
Pours a dark amber with tan head. Has a malty and dark fruit aroma. Taste is similar with aroma buy with a bit of dark liquor included.

Bottle from old backlog notes 07. Pours a clear amber color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet bready malts, caramel, nuts, some spicy hops, earthy, not bad, just not a style I prefer.

Draft at sb. Pours a crystal clear medium amber with golden edges. Loose white head. Big malty sweet caramel brown bread nose. Creamy medium body with soft carb. Toasty caramel mid palate with a long bready finish.
Pours a clear amber color with off-white head. Floral notes, some caramel malts, and some light spice on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with more malt.

Bottle, 330ml. An orange clear beer with a frothy head that fades away after a minute or two. Medium to strong floral aroma with some spices and a considerable amount of alcohol. Taste is not very strong and slightly bitter at the end. It also has a medium alcohol finish and is heavy on astringency and carbonatation.

Bottle, 355ml. Pours clear amber/orange with a modest tan head with plenty of carbonation that recedes the head almost instantly. Aroma is all about the toasted character: caramel, sweet and roasted malts, with hints of alcohol, dry fruits and cereal. Medium to low body, but not watery. Perhaps a bit flat with little astringency. Strong malt backbone and bitter finish to match. Good, very drinkable beer.

Bottle pour. Clean amber, with creamy white head. Sweet aroma of fruit cake, girl scout cookies, and distant grassy hops. Sweet taste, with malt dominate. Plums and cherries. Hint of caramel. Medium body.

Appearance: clear copper/amber, with a short, creamy white head.  Aroma: aromatic, with caramel and toffee malts, graham cracker, a hint of cinnamon, and a surprising dose of yeasty spice. Presentation: It was poured from a green12oz bottle into my Hofbrau mug. It has a very short description on the back label but there is no mention of abv or a freshness date.

Appearance: Its body has a deep sunset orange hue with very good clarity. Sitting on top of this inviting brew is a tall but fleeting white head. It settles quickly and leaves only a thin filmy covering which needs a slight swirl to maintain.

Smell: The nose is fairly light and simple. I mostly get notes of herbal/mineral like hops with some sweet toffee and brown sugary like bready maltiness for balance.

Taste/Palate: There is a balance here between sweet malt and hop bitterness. Its maltiness matches the nose with notes of sweet bread, toffee and brown sugar. This blends with hop notes that add some crispness and dryness to the finish as well as earthy/leafy and a heavy herbal/mineral flavor notes along the way. The plate has a medium feel with balanced medium carbonation. This gives it excellent drinkability. 

Notes: The first few sips are heavy on the mineral notes and are bit distracting. Luckily this fades somewhat as it warms and more of the sweetness comes out. Overall I would call this a good average Maibock.

Smell: The nose is fairly light and simple. I mostly get notes of herbal/mineral like hops with some sweet toffee and brown sugary like bready maltiness for balance.

Taste/Palate: There is a balance here between sweet malt and hop bitterness. Its maltiness matches the nose with notes of sweet bread, toffee and brown sugar. This blends with hop notes that add some crispness and dryness to the finish as well as earthy/leafy and a heavy herbal/mineral flavor notes along the way. 33cl bottle.   Just getting into the hofbrau line, after having their o-fest back in the tent in munich a couple years back.   They do a very respectable pale wiesen-style beer for the festival, which is almost as good in bottles here if you can find it kept out of the light (green bottle syndrome).   I see the weisen-style oktoberfests as pretty much a baby maibock, so its no surprise that this is also a very solid effort.   Clear amber in color, is sports a big fluffy white head that settles to a ring of foam after a few minutes.   The aroma has a rich bready malt profile with a touch of caramel and dark bread crust.   Plenty of melanoidins, which is what drives the style for me.   There is also a lingering background spicy hop touch.   The flavor has much of the same rich melanoidin character as the aroma, and balances it with a healthy hop bitterness and spicy hop flavor that supports.   Medium bodied with tight carbonation.   Slight caramel sweetness in the finish.   Just a touch of oxidation shows, no doubt from age and travel, but this beer is robust enough to weather it quite well.   A tasty maibock, and one that could get you in trouble if you were in Munich drinking it by the maß.

amber color slight carbonation on pour littleto no headlow to no aroma slight spice low hops toasty malt and adjunt (corn?) flavor not the best of this style but not the worst

[Draft @ Hofbrauhaus, Las Vegas] Poured an amber color with a large, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of toasted dough, nuts, and caramel malts. Taste of sweet caramel up front, dry, woody hops, some nuts, toast, light citrus, and a dry finish. No alcohol detected.
Yeast aroma with some malt coming through. Clear dark orange color with a small white head. Malt beginning with a tangy yeast finish. Moderate body.

Bottle.  Pours a lively sappy amber with a thin body.  Stratus clouds form the head on the top of the beverage.  Nose is bits of caramelized peach and roasted nut.  Slight touch of bananas foster in there as well.  Flavor is a touch of roasted malt and syrup.  Average mouthfeel but the flavors are dispersed slowly and wide along the tongue.  Nice brew.  Glad I bought a sixer of this.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: 12 ounce green bottle from a 6 pack that was purchased at the Nugget in Vacaville, CA.  Floral, grainy, lightly sweet grainy aroma.  Pleasant.  Light amber/copper body that is transparent.  Medium-small off-yellow head.  Start is a bit floral, cereal-like, grainy, and lightly metallic.  Nice roasty malts with a lightly herbal hop finish.  I am typically not a fan of this style, but this is flavorful and subtle.  Much better than many American interpretations.
Light orange color with thin lasting white head; typical aroma for style(malty/grainy) but on the light side; flavor is also typical but above average; finishes long nice malty/grainy some dryness.
light copper color with very thin white head, a little malty no after taste...

12 oz green bottle. Light amber with fine offwhite moderate head with some persistance. Aroma of carmel malt sweetness with a hint of german hop aroma. No skunkiness on this bottle. Flavor of carmel sweet malt with a hint of spice-clove and bananna. Malt sweetness lasts well into finish. Classic example of maibock style, malt accentuated with just enough hops to ballance out. YUM
Amber beer with thin white head.  Sweet aroma of caramel and fruits. And apples.  Taste of caramel and sweet malts.  Very malty, as expected.  Decent bock.

I tried this one from a bottle. Very nice nutty aroma. Looks stunning in the glass with its rich amber color and medium-sized white foamy head. Flavor is fairly malty, smooth tasty caramel finish. CO2 level could have been a little higher. I would not partake in too many of these in the heat of our Florida summer, but definitely my favorite with food as it is not too heavy or filling.
Bottle, 330ml. A clear dark red colour. Aroma is hoppy with caramel. Taste has fresh hops with more caramel and malt. Nice enough, but not very exciting.

Deep copper, but clear, with and oarangish tint and moderate bubbing. 2inch dirty-white, frothy head that lasts a while and leaves good lacing on the glass. This brew gives off the aroma of  nothing but full flavored malts, and floral hops. Tastes good. Flavor is rich and full... malty, of course, but despite being a heller bock, quite the amount of nice, balancing hops as well. Very satisfying, not an attribute that can be given to "most" beers. Feel is a little heavy, so know that ahead of time and enjoy accodingly. Finish is full and leaves a light malty aftertaste.
Sampled at a tasting... poured copper with minimal white head. Aroma is malt and hint of alcohol. Flavor was similar, but the alcohol was more prominent and was a bit sharp overall. Not my favorite.

a bit nutty and a malt character that is barley and mainly grainlike with a barely straw like notation. alcohol is as a brandy, fruity with that kind of a refined though milder alcohol presence.velvety yet thin enough for the heat. a nice muted sweetness that makes for a drinkable and balanced grog. good.

[bottle]
Nutty, grainy, and a little raisiny in the nose, along with just a touch of ethanol.  Clear amber with a tawny fuzz that rapidly drops to nothing.  Smooth, almost sherry-like flavour that is not quite as grainy or nutty as the aroma might have suggested.  For this style, the balance is on the side of bitterness, but it is not too dominating.  A pleasant sweetness still comes out along with the malt flavour.  Medium body, medium carbonation, quite smooth and a little warming.

On tap at Mr. Dunderbaks (Tampa, FL).  Pours a rich golden amber color with a medium white head.  Aroma is sweet, malty, spicy, with hint of alcohol.  Good flavor, mostly roasted malt with sweetness in the aftertaste.  Very drinkable at 7.2%

On tap at the Oldsmar Tap House. Pours deep gold with white head. The aroma is bold with a load of somewhat light fruity esters and a mild backbone of Munich malt graininess. The taste is similar to the nose with a big bright hit of fruitiness up front that seems to be sort of pears, apples and raisins. Then a bit of balance is created by grainy Munich malts. But by midway and to the finish the fruitiness dominates and is accompanied by a mild fruit sourness that is out of place. The flavors seem too bright and needs to mellow out a bit.

A very medium of the road heller. Aroma was very weak. Could pick up caramel malt and a hint of roastiness. Pour was nice enough. A medium brown with a one finger off white head. Taste was pretty bland. Caramel, roasted malt and a bit of butter with no aftertaste. Was expecting a lot more from a German brewer. Good carbonation kept this beer interesting.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: This beer is what Ive always aspired to as a home brewer - a deceptive abv% relative to taste, a translucent, but not cloudy, pour (albeit no decent head to speak of) and a malty, sweet taste with just the right amount of carbonation - not quite up there with your standard pilseners, but not as reserved as a porter...a really nice medium.  The only drawback, in my opinion, is the price relative to the product...for half the price and 2/3 the taste, you could buy a Shiner Bock or even an Amber Bock (alright, 1/3 the taste) albeit with a little less kick...

Pour is bright lightly clear amber with a thin off white head...smell is lightly toasty with caramel and bread crumbs...taste is sweet with corn and some toasty malt flavor but turns bitter and vegetal very quickly...bitter gross finish...

12 oz bottle from Total Wine in Jacksonville.  Pours a nice dark amber/copper color with a touch of a white head.  Aroma is malt and a bit of spice.  Taste is malty and has a light sweet aftertaste.  Not bad, in fact, rather nice to drink.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2008 On tap at Oldsmar Tap House. Pours a transparent copper, with a fluffy billowing white head, and tons of lacing. Sweet malt aroma, cinnamon, spices, bitter acidic hops. Spicy mouthfeel, strong malt-driven body, grainy, yet sweet, after taste. Drinkable for 7.2%, medium-body. Pretty decent.

Draft @ Rustico.  Clear cherry amber colored body.  Sweet, starchy, light and fresh flavor... some sweet honey flavored malts, some starchy - slightly coarse - texture to the body.  Overall very refreshing, well-preserved (fresh tasting), and satisfying.  Mildly hopped, festive, vivid, fresh, tasty.

Bought at 6 pack at Norms as soon as this came out. Poured a light orange color in the glass, and the head quickly dissipated. Aroma was very sweet and malty, probably too sweet for my tastes. The flavor was intense, with strong spicy notes backed by an intense alcohol kick at 7.2%ABV. Not exactly what I expected as a beer to welcome the coming of spring, but may be true to the style. Makes me long for the real summer beers like Oberon and even Sam Adams Summer Ale.

Pours a lightly hazy copper amber with a medium light beige head.  Smells pretty mild overall.  Some definite caramel and sweet malt, but not much else in the nose.  The flavor was much more lively, alot of that caramel and sweet malt show in the taste as well.  Light hoppiness to it, especially in the finish, which is lightly bitter, but not bad at all.  Decent heller bock, somewhat of a surprise.

Bottle. Pours translucent amber with medium beige head, quickly dissappating, leaving light lace. Aroma is dough, hints of hay and very light hop herbal notes. Flavor is toasted grainy bread, caramel, layers of herbal hop flavor throughout. Finish is moderately bitter, lightly oily herbal hops and mild alcohol. Bitterness and herbal flavors linger. Mouthfeel is fluffy, lightly oily. Overall impression - Nice bready body with a bite at the end - quite excellent!

Thanks to Deanna for helping me rate this. Pours a reddish amber with a thin white head. Malty aroma with a hint of nuts and a little cardboard. Taste is very malty and smooth, very drinkable. A little thicker and darker than the regular helles.
Very nicem, not so crafty, but nice spicy aroma, and sour taste. Very alcoholic taste and brown ale features.

12oz bottle poured in a lager glass.  HMM pours golden and slightly hazy but with no discernible pulp.  The nose is light and hard to describe but fresh linen, honey and fruit come to mind. The taste is quite mild and enjoyable.  The malt dominates but a faint floral flavor is evident as well.  This tastes like a nice session beer but at 7.2% ABV I wouldnt recommend making an evening of these.  The alcohol is non-evident despite its elevated status.  The body is medium in weight with little aftertaste.  This is a nice "average" beer.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2008 On tap at Bavarian Grill, Plano, TX.
Good beer....poured a dark clear, reddish amber with off white head. Aroma was great, all that malty sweetness hitting your nose. Flavor was very good, nice malty and dark roast flavors and seems to have a hint of honey. Spicy on the toung. Would buy again....Need to drink with a smoked braut next time.....

pours a crystal clear reddish copper with a yellowy tan head.  aroma of sweet malt, pepper and toasty bread.  a faint hint of apple.  taste is some green pepper, malt, some corn, very subtle hops, some earthy notes, and some cider.  main flavors dissapate fairly quickly, but a nice dry sensation is left in the mouth.  nice lacing, and a thin layer of head remains.  really cant taste the alcohol at all.  mid-bodied with a smooth and crisp palate.  slight metallic flavor.  would go nicely in a stein!
Tasted thanks to Greig! Lovely enjoyable Maibock, one of my favourites by HB. Has a great mouthfeel coupled with lovely malty peppery, heathery notes coupled with a touch of smoke.

A very tasty Maibock, full of toasted bread notes, and a hint of smoke. Not as sweet as I remember it, and a great balancing bitterness, though no noticable hop aroma. Far too easy to drink for a 7.2% beer!
An interesting beer. Looks very good in the glass, dark, nearly copper-coloured. Its strong but not too dry, its easy to keep it in mind. A good beer.

Pours a nicely hued red color with a nice head.  It has aromas that are dry and semi sweet bread dough and biscuit.  It is well rounded, fuller bodied for this style, and offers an aray of biscuit malt, caramel, and slight hop resin.  It is creamy, and smooth, and dense.  It is a solid heller.

This Bock pours a dark red colour with a nice tan thick density head. to the nose there are scents of apples and pears, sweet malts and dough. A little floral scent. First taste is sweet with a nice hopp flavour. A nice floral taste with sweet malt aftertaste. The finish is also very sweet with a little bitterness.

Sampler at <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/illinois/frankf Liquors, Frankfort. Pale bock color. A light malt nose. Shows its backing of Crystal or Vienna roast malts. Solid malt taste without much arguement from any hops. Rests well on the tongue and goes down nicely.

Tap. Malts have a moderate caramel and roasted smell, hops have a very light herb smell and light dough for the yeast with white wine, oak and cooked corn in the background. Head is between creamy and fizzy, white with good lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is a clear orange/tan. Flavor starts very lightly sweet and lightly acidic and the finish is lightly acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is light to medium, between watery and creamy with a lively carbonation and a lightly astringent finish. Maltier than I expected from a maibock, but very good regardless.

Full sweetish malt aroma, typical syrupy strong malt flavor with just a hint of the roast underneath.  Nicely offset where many others have the sweetness take over.  Just a slight bitterness of the hops in the finish, just the right balance against the start.  Just a hint of the 7.2% alcohol at the very end - but just so well balanced as not to be an issue.
[Sampled in 2005 at svogers outside fireplace.] This was a very good bock enjoyed with some gemütliches firefood. Fullbodied with whiskynotes.

bottle - Pours amber with a thin head and a malty aroma.  The flavor is led by the malt as is typical for the style.  I can also taste a little alcohol and some mild hops.  Its medium bodied, smooth, and makes for a pretty good session brew.
A nice, acceptable bock. Since we get too few of these, this will saty in my rotation.

draught in Munich. pours clear copper with off white head. nose is nutty and toffee. hint of smoke. flavor is malty, caramelly, and toasted biscuit. some fresh piney hops. very tasty. feel is watery. refreshing and malty.

Sweet malty aroma but with some hops added in.  Pours the color of fresh motor oil with a nice tan head.  Flavor is syrupy malt and caramel.  Moderate effervescence.  A very pleasant drinking experience.  Plenty of sweetness, a bit tart and bitter, nice aroma.  Enjoyable.
Bottle.  Pours amber with a thick off-white head.  Aroma is malt-dominated.  Taste is quite malty with some toasty astringentness.    Maybe a touch of alcohol.
Bottle. Nice big head with good duration. Color is amber. aroma is sweet malt. Taste is sweet malt with a bit of alcohol.

My first officially documented Maibock, 

Pours a dark golden maple syrup-brown...

good honey, malt, fresh baked cookie aroma...

has a very nice bitterness level...

nicely balanced...

an enjoyable brew that works well in many levels...

i can see this as a staple in a bock lovers fridge...

i will buy afew bottles for my grandpa and uncle (dutch-german backgrounds), bcuz i know they would love this!

Bottle-The aroma from the pour worry me at first, skunky, but then settled down into a good carmel, malty scent.  The pour produce a medium, fuzzy head that die quickly with a solid copper color.  The taste had both caramel and malt tastes but a little thin.  However, thats what one should expect for a springtime beer.

12oz. bottle. color is a good looking copper hue, the beer pours with a cream colored light head. nose has some toasted brown sugar, caramel and grainy malts with a soft fruitiness. full caramel palate with a fairly long lasting rich flavor and nice medium body. nice clean finish with good bittering hops

Bottle Crystal clear, amber lager with copper highlights. Malty and breadsy aroma with lots of caramel and toffee. Flavor-wise, its a malt bomb that leans way onto the sweet side of balance, but is far from cloying. Medium to heavy sweetness countered with moderate bitterness and a whisper of acidity. Medium-bodied with fizzy carbonation. Perfectly-balanced, lightly acidic, caramel finish. I do dig me a malt bomb!
Crisp and clean, with predominant sweet malty tones. A bit thin, not much in the finish, but better than I expected. Still, if it were a bit more daring it could really be something.

Pours into a coper clear, no sedi. Nice little fluffy head dissipates quickly. Chocolate malts and roasted nuts are present. Nice statue, but thin...little chewy, a little buttery...nut not nipply enough. Enjoyable non das lease.
Amber colour with a creamy head. Malty, buttery taste with a hint of hops. Rather light mouthfeel, but not too thin anyway.
Ornage body. Begie head. Sweet burnt malt in aroma and flavor.

Ruby/copper colored with smaller head.wheaty spiceness on the nose, a little peppery, evidence of some seductive malts.  The malts reveal themselves in a caramel toastyness, and finishes with a clovey pepper spice.  Lighter bodied and finishes a little thin, but a quenching aspect is a nice touch at the end.

Its a tasty beer...really...Ive been into German brews since the early 1980s for quality, consistency and price point.  This Hofbrau delight is really smooth and tasty, nice amber malts, rich and easy to drink, full bodied but not out there.  Smooth and lovely caramel malt beer is easy to drink.  Copper with a little head at first bottle pour.  Lovely!!
Bottle. Amber/orange color, offwhite head. Malty aroma, fruity notes, some raisins, some toffee notes. Malty flavor, fruity notes and some bitterness.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2007 This is definitely a nice maibock, a little sweet with lots of caramel and bittersweet malt, a very nice large head, and an appetizing copper color.
On tap 1/2 liter.  Poured light amber with a full white head.  The aroma was overwhelmingly honey.  The taste was also full of honey but was not too sweet and was quite pleasant.
(Bottle)  Pours a clear amber with a medium-sized creamy off-white head.  Aroma is sweet (fruitiness, caramel) and somewhat musty.  Flavor of sweet caramel and mild hops.  Tastes really fresh.

Pours a ruby reddish orange into the glass with a nice white head on it.  The aroma is really quite nice and is full of dark fruit aromas along with the sugary smell of sweet malt.  The flavor really is true to the aroma of this beer with an exceptional malt backbone that hides the 7.2% very well.  This beer is relatively light as it sweeps across the palate but has enough presence to really be enjoyed.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2013 Date: 4/25/2007
Event: Junedale Beer Klub - April Beer Tasting (Maibocks)
Serving: 12 oz bottles shared by Supa.
Tasting Notes

Flavor: Toasted malts and light caramel.  Mild spicy/noble hops.  Well blended and flavors are well integrated.
Palate: Smooth and clean.
Overall: Very enjoyable and easy to drink!  Its difficult to go wrong with an HB beer...
Score: 7/3/7/4/14=3.5

7/07/2010:  Hofbrau Maibock...  Aroma:  Hawaiian bread; brown sugar syrup.  Appearance:  Copper with an off-white crown; mostly transparent; mild carbonation.  Flavor:  Stong; even bitterness; moderate bitterness in the finish; easty and toasty.  Palate:  Medium-bodied; smooth.  Overall:  Okay/tolerable; nothing special; Maibock has never been a style that I enjoy...
Sample from 12 fl. oz. bottle (7.2% ABV) at Martys Hops and Vines in North College Hill (Cincinnati, Ohio).  Rating:  6/3/6/4/13 = 3.2
poured a nice copper color with a medium size head.  A nice malty aroma with some bread notes and a light caramel note. Flavor was subtly sweet with malty notes, at times seeming one dementional.

Tap @ Mellow Mushroom Brandon, Fl. Pours a clear copper with a one finger white head that lasts leaving good lacing. Aroma is fresh malt and a light note of caramel malt. Taste is the same as aroma with a well balanced bitterness. Medium thin mouthfeel that finishes dry and bitter. Very good.

Low intensity malt aroma with mild candied fruit notes.  The body is a bright amber/copper and supports a nice looking, two finger thick, white head that is mostly lasting. Very malty fore, some cramel and faint fruit and grain notes. Very low bitterness. A malt driven experience from start to finish and a tasty one.

Bottle and on tap.  Copper amber color, rich malty flavor with hops emerging.  Crisp, clean finish.  Very flavourful for a lager.  I have had this by itself, and at a tasting side be side with Rogue Dead Guy Ale, which is based on a maibock recipe, but fermented with ale yeast instead of lager yeast.  Fascinating pairing, as you can really taste and see the difference made by the ale yeast.

Pours a mostly clear orangish/coppery/amber under a small, yellowhite head. Malted aroma dominates with mild roasted cornhusks and grassy hops. Ketchup joins late. (I observed acidity and raspberries in this beer two years ago...) Smooth and dry with a perfect flavor-balance of malts & hops, finishing on a clean bitter note. A very good Maibock.
